column3: utACK. Can't hurt.\nBut i guess installing `automake` will install `autoconf` (as depends)?\n

> But i guess installing `automake` will install `autoconf` (as depends)?

Ah, good point (for both Ubuntu and Debian). Fixed (rebased).

Isn't it the other way around - doesn't autoconf install automake as dependency?

I've installed bitcoin core on many VMs (both Debian and Ubuntu) from scratch by following just the build-unix.md instructions, I'm not convinced that this change is needed.

@laanwj wrote:

> Isn't it the other way around - doesn't autoconf install automake as dependency?

No. You are confusing their relationship. From https://www.gnu.org/software/automake/#introduction (**_emphasis**_ added):

> Automake is a tool for automatically generating `Makefile.in` files compliant with the GNU Coding Standards. **_Automake requires the use of [Autoconf](https://www.gnu.
